apiClassifier.shortdesc: The CSSRule interface is the abstract base interface for any type of CSS statement.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
The CSSRule interface is the abstract base interface for any type of CSS statement.
This includes both rule sets and at-rules. An implementation is expected to preserve all rules specified in a CSS style sheet, even if the rule is not recognized by the parser. Unrecognized rules are represented using the CSSUnknownRule interface.

apiValue.shortdesc: The rule is a CSSCharsetRule.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The rule is a CSSCharsetRule.

apiValue.shortdesc: The rule is a CSSFontFaceRule.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The rule is a CSSFontFaceRule.

apiValue.shortdesc: The rule is a CSSImportRule.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The rule is a CSSImportRule.

apiValue.shortdesc: The rule is a CSSMediaRule.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The rule is a CSSMediaRule.

apiValue.shortdesc: The rule is a CSSPageRule.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The rule is a CSSPageRule.

apiValue.shortdesc: The rule is a CSSStyleRule.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The rule is a CSSStyleRule.

apiValue.shortdesc: The rule is a CSSUnknownRule.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The rule is a CSSUnknownRule.

apiValue.shortdesc: The parsable textual representation of the rule.

apiException.apiDesc: SYNTAX_ERR: Raised if the specified CSS string value has a syntax error and is unparsable.
INVALID_MODIFICATION_ERR: Raised if the specified CSS string value represents a different type of rule than the current one.
HIERARCHY_REQUEST_ERR: Raised if the rule cannot be inserted at this point in the style sheet.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if the rule is readonly.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The parsable textual representation of the rule. This reflects the current state of the rule and not its initial value.

apiValue.shortdesc: If this rule is contained inside another rule (e.g.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: If this rule is contained inside another rule (e.g. a style rule inside an @media block), this is the containing rule. If this rule is not nested inside any other rules, this returns null.

apiValue.shortdesc: The style sheet that contains this rule.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The style sheet that contains this rule.

apiValue.shortdesc: The type of the rule, as defined above.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
The type of the rule, as defined above.
The expectation is that binding-specific casting methods can be used to cast down from an instance of the CSSRule interface to the specific derived interface implied by the type.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: The CSSCharsetRule interface represents a @charset rule in a CSS style sheet.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
The CSSCharsetRule interface represents a @charset rule in a CSS style sheet.
The value of the encoding attribute does not affect the encoding of text data in the DOM objects; this encoding is always UTF-16. After a stylesheet is loaded, the value of the encoding attribute is the value found in the @charset rule. If there was no @charset in the original document, then no CSSCharsetRule is created. The value of the encoding attribute may also be used as a hint for the encoding used on serialization of the style sheet.
The value of the @charset rule (and therefore of the CSSCharsetRule) may not correspond to the encoding the document actually came in; character encoding information e.g. in an HTTP header, has priority but this is not reflected in the CSSCharsetRule.

apiValue.shortdesc: The encoding information used in this @charset rule.

apiException.apiDesc: SYNTAX_ERR: Raised if the specified CSS string value has a syntax error and is unparsable.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this declaration is readonly or a property is readonly.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The encoding information used in this @charset rule.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: The RGBColor interface is used to represent any RGB color value.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
The RGBColor interface is used to represent any RGB color value.
This interface reflects the values in the underlying style property. Hence, modifications made to the CSSPrimitiveValue objects modify the style property.
A specified RGB color is not clipped (even if the number is outside the range 0-255 or 0%-100%). A computed RGB color is clipped depending on the device.
Even if a style sheet can only contain an integer for a color value, the internal storage of this integer is a float, and this can be used as a float in the specified or the computed style.
A color percentage value can always be converted to a number and vice versa.

apiValue.shortdesc: This attribute is used for the blue value of the RGB color.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: This attribute is used for the blue value of the RGB color.

apiValue.shortdesc: This attribute is used for the green value of the RGB color.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: This attribute is used for the green value of the RGB color.

apiValue.shortdesc: This attribute is used for the red value of the RGB color.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: This attribute is used for the red value of the RGB color.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: The CSSUnknownRule interface represents an at-rule not supported by this user agent.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: The CSSUnknownRule interface represents an at-rule not supported by this user agent.

apiClassifier.shortdesc:
INCOMPLETE
The CSS2Properties interface represents a convenience mechanism for retrieving and setting properties within a CSSStyleDeclaration.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
INCOMPLETE
The CSS2Properties interface represents a convenience mechanism for retrieving and setting properties within a CSSStyleDeclaration.
The attributes of this interface correspond to all the properties specified in CSS2. Getting an attribute of this interface is equivalent to calling the getPropertyValue method of the CSSStyleDeclaration interface. Setting an attribute of this interface is equivalent to calling the setProperty method of the CSSStyleDeclaration interface.
Note: When the margin property is set, for example, the marginTop, marginRight, marginBottom and marginLeft properties are actually being set.

apiValue.shortdesc: In combination with elevation, azimuth enables different audio sources to be positioned spatially for aural presentation.

apiException.apiDesc: SYNTAX_ERR: Raised if the new value has a syntax error and is unparsable.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this property is readonly.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
In combination with elevation, azimuth enables different audio sources to be positioned spatially for aural presentation.
This is important in that it provides a natural way to tell several voices apart, as each can be positioned to originate at a different location on the sound stage. Stereo output produce a lateral sound stage, while binaural headphones and multi-speaker setups allow for a fully three-dimensional stage.
azimuth: angle | [[ left-side | far-left | left | center-left | center | center-right | right | far-right | right-side ] || behind ] | leftwards | rightwards | inherit
angle
Audible source position is described as an angle within the range -360deg to 360deg. The value 0deg means directly ahead in the center of the sound stage (this is the default value). 90deg is to the right, 180deg is behind, and 270deg or -90deg is to the left.
Positional keywords
left-side: Same as 270deg.
left-side behind: Same as 270deg.
far-left: Same as 300deg.
far-left behind: Same as 240deg.
left: Same as 320deg.
left behind: Same as 220deg.
center-left: Same as 340deg.
center-left behind: Same as 200deg.
center: Same as 0deg.
center behind: Same as 180deg.
center-right: Same as 20deg.
center-right behind: Same as 160deg.
right: Same as 40deg.
right behind: Same as 140deg.
far-right: Same as 60deg.
far-right behind: Same as 120deg.
right-side: Same as 90deg.
right-side behind: Same as 90deg.
behind: Same as 180deg. Also used as a modifier for other positional keyword values, as above.
leftwards: Moves the sound counter-clockwise by 20 degrees, relative to the current angle.
rightwards: Moves the sound clockwise by 20 degrees, relative to the current angle.

example.codeblock: h1 { azimuth: 30deg } td.a { azimuth: far-right } /~~ 60deg ~~/ #12 { azimuth: behind far-right } /~~ 120deg ~~/ p.comment { azimuth: behind } /~~ 180deg ~~/

apiValue.shortdesc: The background property is a shorthand property for setting the individual background property values in a single place in the style sheet.

apiException.apiDesc: SYNTAX_ERR: Raised if the new value has a syntax error and is unparsable.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this property is readonly.

apiValue.shortdesc: If a background-image is specified, background-attachment determines whether that image's position is fixed within the viewport, or scrolls along with its containing block.

apiException.apiDesc: SYNTAX_ERR: Raised if the new value has a syntax error and is unparsable.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this property is readonly.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
If a background-image is specified, background-attachment determines whether that image's position is fixed within the viewport, or scrolls along with its containing block.
background-attachment: scroll | fixed | inherit
scroll
If scroll is specified, the background image will scroll within the viewport along with the block the image is contained within.
inherit
If fixed is specified, the background image will not scroll with its containing element, instead remaining stationary within the viewport.

apiValue.shortdesc: background-color sets the background color of an element, either through a color value or the keyword transparent.

apiException.apiDesc: SYNTAX_ERR: Raised if the new value has a syntax error and is unparsable.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this property is readonly.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
background-color sets the background color of an element, either through a color value or the keyword transparent.
background-color: color | transparent | inherit
color
The color can be specified as a hexidecimal RGB value, a regular RGB value, or by using one of the pre-defined color keywords.
transparent
The default value for background-color is transparent meaning the element has no color of its own, instead showing the color of the element behind it.

apiValue.shortdesc: The background-image property sets the background image for an element.

apiException.apiDesc: SYNTAX_ERR: Raised if the new value has a syntax error and is unparsable.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this property is readonly.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
The background-image property sets the background image for an element.
background-image: uri | none | inherit
Note: Developers should ensure that they specify a background-color to be used if an image is not available. Background images are rendered on top of the background color.
uri
The location of the image resource to be used as a background image.
none
Used to specify that an element is to have no background image.

example.codeblock:
body { background-image: url("images/darkpattern.png"); }
p { background-image: none; }

apiValue.shortdesc: background-position sets the initial position of any background image that has been set.

apiException.apiDesc: SYNTAX_ERR: Raised if the new value has a syntax error and is unparsable.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this property is readonly.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
background-position sets the initial position of any background image that has been set.
background-position: [ <percentage> | <length> | left | center | right ] [ <percentage> | <length> | top | center | bottom ] ? ;
background-position: [ top | center | bottom ];
background-position: inherit;
<percentage>
With a value pair of '0% 0%', the upper left corner of the image is aligned with the upper left corner of the box's padding edge. A value pair of '100% 100%' places the lower right corner of the image in the lower right corner of padding area. With a value pair of '14% 84%', the point 14% across and 84% down the image is to be placed at the point 14% across and 84% down the padding area.
<length>
With a value pair of '2cm 1cm', the upper left corner of the image is placed 2cm to the right and 1cm below the upper left corner of the padding area.
top left and left top
Same as '0% 0%'.
top, top center, and center top
Same as '50% 0%'.
right top and top right
Same as '100% 0%'.
left, left center, and center left
Same as '0% 50%'.
center and center center
Same as '50% 50%'.
right, right center, and center right
Same as '100% 50%'.
bottom left and left bottom
Same as '0% 100%'.
bottom, bottom center, and center bottom
Same as '50% 100%'.
bottom right and right bottom
Same as '100% 100%'.
If only one value is specified, then it sets the horizontal position, with the vertical position at 50%. Otherwise, the first value specifies the horizontal position. Combinations are allowed of keyword, length, or percentage values, but if keywords are mixed with other values, 'left' and 'right' may only be used as the first value, and 'top' and 'bottom' may only be used as the second value. Negative positions are allowed.

apiValue.shortdesc: background-repeat specifies whether the image is repeated (tiled), and how.

apiException.apiDesc: SYNTAX_ERR: Raised if the new value has a syntax error and is unparsable.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this property is readonly.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
background-repeat specifies whether the image is repeated (tiled), and how.
background-repeat: repeat | repeat-x | repeat-y | no-repeat | inherit
repeat
The image is repeated both horizontally and vertically.
repeat-x
The image is repeated horizontally only.
repeat-y
The image is repeated vertically only.
no-repeat
The image is not repeated: only one copy of the image is drawn.

SYNTAX_ERR: Raised if the new value has a syntax error and is unparsable.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this property is readonly.
SYNTAX_ERR: Raised if the new value has a syntax error and is unparsable.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this property is readonly.
SYNTAX_ERR: Raised if the new value has a syntax error and is unparsable.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this property is readonly.
SYNTAX_ERR: Raised if the new value has a syntax error and is unparsable.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this property is readonly.
SYNTAX_ERR: Raised if the new value has a syntax error and is unparsable.

SYNTAX_ERR: Raised if the new value has a syntax error and is unparsable.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this property is readonly.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: The CSSImportRule interface represents a @import rule within a CSS style sheet.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: The CSSImportRule interface represents a @import rule within a CSS style sheet. The @import rule is used to import style rules from other style sheets.

apiValue.shortdesc: The location of the style sheet to be imported.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The location of the style sheet to be imported. The attribute will not contain the "url(...)" specifier around the URI.

apiValue.shortdesc: A list of media types for which this style sheet may be used.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: A list of media types for which this style sheet may be used.

apiValue.shortdesc: The style sheet referred to by this rule, if it has been loaded.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The style sheet referred to by this rule, if it has been loaded. The value of this attribute is null if the style sheet has not yet been loaded or if it will not be loaded.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: The CSSMediaRule interface represents a @media rule in a CSS style sheet.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: The CSSMediaRule interface represents a @media rule in a CSS style sheet. A @media rule can be used to delimit style rules for specific media types.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Used to delete a rule from the media block.

apiException.apiDesc: INDEX_SIZE_ERR: Raised if the specified index does not correspond to a rule in the media rule list.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this media rule is readonly.

apiParam.apiDesc: The index within the media block's rule collection of the rule to remove.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Used to delete a rule from the media block.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Used to insert a new rule into the media block.

apiException.apiDesc: HIERARCHY_REQUEST_ERR: Raised if the rule cannot be inserted at the specified index, e.g., if an @import rule is inserted after a standard rule set or other at-rule.
INDEX_SIZE_ERR: Raised if the specified index is not a valid insertion point.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this media rule is readonly.
SYNTAX_ERR: Raised if the specified rule has a syntax error and is unparsable.

apiReturn.apiDesc: The index within the media block's rule collection of the newly inserted rule.

apiParam.apiDesc: The parsable text representing the rule. For rule sets this contains both the selector and the style declaration. For at-rules, this specifies both the at-identifier and the rule content.

The index within the media block's rule collection of the rule before which to insert the specified rule. If the specified index is equal to the length of the media blocks's rule collection, the rule will be added to the end of the media block.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Used to insert a new rule into the media block.

apiValue.shortdesc: A list of all CSS rules contained within the media block.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: A list of all CSS rules contained within the media block.

apiValue.shortdesc: A list of media types for this rule.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: A list of media types for this rule.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: The Counter interface is used to represent any counter or counters function value.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: The Counter interface is used to represent any counter or counters function value. This interface reflects the values in the underlying style property.

apiValue.shortdesc: This attribute is used for the identifier of the counter.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: This attribute is used for the identifier of the counter.

apiValue.shortdesc: This attribute is used for the style of the list.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: This attribute is used for the style of the list.

apiValue.shortdesc: This attribute is used for the separator of the nested counters.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: This attribute is used for the separator of the nested counters.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This interface represents a document with a CSS view.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
This interface represents a document with a CSS view.
The getOverrideStyle method provides a mechanism through which a DOM author could effect immediate change to the style of an element without modifying the explicitly linked style sheets of a document or the inline style of elements in the style sheets. This style sheet comes after the author style sheet in the cascade algorithm and is called override style sheet. The override style sheet takes precedence over author style sheets. An "!important" declaration still takes precedence over a normal declaration. Override, author, and user style sheets all may contain "!important" declarations. User "!important" rules take precedence over both override and author "!important" rules, and override "!important" rules take precedence over author "!important" rules.
The expectation is that an instance of the DocumentCSS interface can be obtained by using binding-specific casting methods on an instance of the Document interface.

apiOperation.shortdesc: This method is used to retrieve the override style declaration for a specified element and a specified pseudo-element.

apiParam.apiDesc: The element whose style is to be modified. This parameter cannot be null.
The pseudo-element or null if none.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: This method is used to retrieve the override style declaration for a specified element and a specified pseudo-element.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: The CSSFontFaceRule interface represents a @font-face rule in a CSS style sheet.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: The CSSFontFaceRule interface represents a @font-face rule in a CSS style sheet. The @font-face rule is used to hold a set of font descriptions.

apiValue.shortdesc: The declaration-block of this rule.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The declaration-block of this rule.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: The CSSRuleList interface provides the abstraction of an ordered collection of CSS rules.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
The CSSRuleList interface provides the abstraction of an ordered collection of CSS rules.
The items in the CSSRuleList are accessible via an integral index, starting from 0.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Used to retrieve a CSS rule by ordinal index.

apiReturn.apiDesc: The style rule at the index position in the CSSRuleList, or null if that is not a valid index.

apiParam.apiDesc: Index into the collection

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Used to retrieve a CSS rule by ordinal index.
The order in this collection represents the order of the rules in the CSS style sheet. If index is greater than or equal to the number of rules in the list, this returns null.

apiValue.shortdesc: The number of CSSRules in the list.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The number of CSSRules in the list. The range of valid child rule indices is 0 to length-1 inclusive.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: The Rect interface is used to represent any rect value.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
The Rect interface is used to represent any rect value.
This interface reflects the values in the underlying style property. Hence, modifications made to the CSSPrimitiveValue objects modify the style property.

apiValue.shortdesc: This attribute is used for the bottom of the rect.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: This attribute is used for the bottom of the rect.

apiValue.shortdesc: This attribute is used for the left of the rect.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: This attribute is used for the left of the rect.

apiValue.shortdesc: This attribute is used for the right of the rect.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: This attribute is used for the right of the rect.

apiValue.shortdesc: This attribute is used for the top of the rect.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: This attribute is used for the top of the rect.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This interface allows the DOM user to create a CSSStyleSheet outside the context of a document.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
This interface allows the DOM user to create a CSSStyleSheet outside the context of a document.
There is no way to associate the new CSSStyleSheet with a document in DOM Level 2.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Creates a new CSSStyleSheet.

apiException.apiDesc: SYNTAX_ERR: Raised if the specified media string value has a syntax error and is unparsable.

apiParam.apiDesc: The advisory title.
The comma-separated list of media associated with the new style sheet.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Creates a new CSSStyleSheet.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: The CSSStyleSheet interface is a concrete interface used to represent a CSS style sheet i.e., a style sheet whose content type is "text/css".

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
The CSSStyleSheet interface is a concrete interface used to represent a CSS style sheet i.e., a style sheet whose content type is "text/css".
All browser compatibility information was obtained via Quirksmode.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Adds a style sheet to the imports collection for the specified style sheet.

apiReturn.apiDesc: Returns a a zero-based index value indicating the position of the imported style sheet in the imports collection.

apiParam.apiDesc: Specifies the location of the source file for the style sheet.
(Optional) Specifies the requested position for the style sheet in the collection. If this value is not given, the style sheet is added to the end of the collection.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Adds a style sheet to the imports collection for the specified style sheet.
Note (IE): Whether a CSS import is made in a CSS file itself (by using @import) or dynamically by JavaScript, the limit per stylesheet is 31. Beyond that number, all other imports in that stylesheet will be ignored. Additionally, when trying to add an import by JavaScript, the browser will return an "Invalid argument" error.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Creates a new page object for a style sheet.

apiOperationDef.apiDefaultValue: The page object is added to the end of the collection.

apiParam.apiDesc: Specifies the selector for the new page object.
Specifies the style assignments for this page object. This style takes the same form as an inline style specification. For example, "color:blue" is a valid style parameter.
Specifies the zero-based position in the pages collection where the new page object should be placed.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Creates a new page object for a style sheet.
Note (IE): Each page object represents a style sheet that corresponds to a @page rule in the document.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Creates a new rule for a style sheet.

apiOperationDef.apiDefaultValue: The page object is added to the end of the collection.

apiParam.apiDesc: Specifies the selector for the new rule. Single contextual selectors are valid. For example, "div p b" is a valid contextual selector.
Specifies the style assignments for this style rule. This style takes the same form as an inline style specification. For example, "color:blue" is a valid style parameter.
(Optional) Specifies the zero-based position in the rules collection where the new style rule should be placed.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Creates a new rule for a style sheet.
Note (IE): You can add up to 4095 style rules with the addRule method. After that, the method returns an "Invalid Argument" exception.
Note (IE): You can apply rules to a disabled styleSheet, but they do not apply to the document until you enable the styleSheet.

example.codeblock: Internet Explorer makes HTML dynamic.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Used to delete a rule from the style sheet.

apiException.apiDesc: INDEX_SIZE_ERR: Raised if the specified index does not correspond to a rule in the style sheet's rule list.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this style sheet is readonly.

apiParam.apiDesc: The index within the style sheet's rule list of the rule to remove.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Used to delete a rule from the style sheet.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Used to insert a new rule into the style sheet.

apiException.apiDesc: HIERARCHY_REQUEST_ERR: Raised if the rule cannot be inserted at the specified index e.g. if an @import rule is inserted after a standard rule set or other at-rule.
INDEX_SIZE_ERR: Raised if the specified index is not a valid insertion point.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this style sheet is readonly.
SYNTAX_ERR: Raised if the specified rule has a syntax error and is unparsable.

apiReturn.apiDesc: The index within the style sheet's rule collection of the newly inserted rule.

apiParam.apiDesc: The parsable text representing the rule. For rule sets this contains both the selector and the style declaration. For at-rules, this specifies both the at-identifier and the rule content.

The index within the style sheet's rule list of the rule before which to insert the specified rule. If the specified index is equal to the length of the style sheet's rule collection, the rule will be added to the end of the style sheet.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Used to insert a new rule into the style sheet. The new rule now becomes part of the cascade.

example.codeblock: // push a new rule onto the top of my stylesheet myStyle.insertRule("#blanc { color: white }", 0);

apiOperation.shortdesc: Removes the imported style sheet from the imports collection based on ordinal position.

apiParam.apiDesc: Indicates which imported style sheet to remove.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Removes the imported style sheet from the imports collection based on ordinal position.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Deletes an existing style rule for the styleSheet object, and adjusts the index of the rules collection accordingly.

apiParam.apiDesc: (Optional) Specifies the index value of the rule to be deleted from the style sheet. If an index is not provided, the first rule in the rules collection is removed.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Deletes an existing style rule for the styleSheet object, and adjusts the index of the rules collection accordingly.
Note (IE): The page does not automatically reflow when the rule is removed. To see the change, you must reflow the page. You can reflow the objects affected using a number of methods. For example, you can reflow the style change only on affected text by setting the text equal to itself. Alternately, you can reload the entire page using the reload method. When you use the refresh method on a table, its content is reflowed.

apiValue.shortdesc: The list of all CSS rules contained within the style sheet.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The list of all CSS rules contained within the style sheet. This includes both rule sets and at-rules.

example.codeblock: // get the first style sheets first rule first_rule = document.styleSheets[0].cssRules[0];

apiValue.shortdesc: If this style sheet comes from an @import rule, the ownerRule attribute will contain the CSSImportRule.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: If this style sheet comes from an @import rule, the ownerRule attribute will contain the CSSImportRule. In that case, the ownerNode attribute in the StyleSheet interface will be null. If the style sheet comes from an element or a processing instruction, the ownerRule attribute will be null and the ownerNode attribute will contain the Node.

apiValue.shortdesc: Retrieves a collection of rules defined in a style sheet.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
Retrieves a collection of rules defined in a style sheet.
Note (IE): IE doesn't count @imports as rules, but splits up selectors like p#test, ul into two rules.

example.codeblock:
Rule 0 is applied to this line.

Rule 1 is applied to this line.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: The CSSStyleRule interface represents a single rule set in a CSS style sheet.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: The CSSStyleRule interface represents a single rule set in a CSS style sheet.

apiValue.shortdesc: Retrieves whether the rule or style sheet is defined on the page or is imported.

apiValueDef.apiDefaultValue: false. Rule or style sheet is obtained through a link object or the @import rule.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
Retrieves whether the rule or style sheet is defined on the page or is imported.
Note (IE): You cannot modify style sheets obtained through a link object or the @import rule while the designMode property is enabled.

apiValue.shortdesc: The textual representation of the selector for the rule set.

apiException.apiDesc: SYNTAX_ERR: Raised if the specified CSS string value has a syntax error and is unparsable.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this rule is readonly.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
The textual representation of the selector for the rule set.
Note: The implementation may have stripped out insignificant whitespace while parsing the selector.

apiValue.shortdesc: The declaration-block of this rule set.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
The declaration-block of this rule set.
Note: The declaration block is that part of the style rule that appears within the braces and that actually provides the style definitions (for the selector, the part that comes before the braces).

apiClassifier.shortdesc: The CSSPageRule interface represents a @page rule within a CSS style sheet.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: The CSSPageRule interface represents a @page rule within a CSS style sheet. The @page rule is used to specify the dimensions, orientation, margins, etc. of a page box for paged media.

apiValue.shortdesc: The parsable textual representation of the page selector for the rule.

apiException.apiDesc: SYNTAX_ERR: Raised if the specified CSS string value has a syntax error and is unparsable.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this rule is readonly.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The parsable textual representation of the page selector for the rule.

apiValue.shortdesc: The declaration-block of this rule.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The declaration-block of this rule.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Inline style information attached to elements is exposed through the style attribute.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
Inline style information attached to elements is exposed through the style attribute.
This represents the contents of the STYLE attribute for HTML elements (or elements in other schemas or DTDs which use the STYLE attribute in the same way). The expectation is that an instance of the ElementCSSInlineStyle interface can be obtained by using binding-specific casting methods on an instance of the Element interface when the element supports inline CSS style informations.

apiValue.shortdesc: Returns an object that represents the element's style attribute.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
Returns an object that represents the element's style attribute.
Note: Since the style property has the same (and highest) priority in the CSS cascade as an inline style declaration via the style attribute, it is useful for setting style on one specific element.
Note: However, it is not useful for learning about the element's style in general, since it represents only the CSS declarations set in the element's inline style attribute, not those that come from style rules elsewhere, such as style rules in the <head> section, or external style sheets.
Note: To get the values of all CSS properties for an element you should use window.getComputedStyle instead.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: The CSSPrimitiveValue interface represents a single CSS value.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
The CSSPrimitiveValue interface represents a single CSS value.
This interface may be used to determine the value of a specific style property currently set in a block or to set a specific style property explicitly within the block. An instance of this interface might be obtained from the getPropertyCSSValue method of the CSSStyleDeclaration interface. A CSSPrimitiveValue object only occurs in a context of a CSS property.
Conversions are allowed between absolute values (from millimeters to centimeters, from degrees to radians, and so on) but not between relative values. (For example, a pixel value cannot be converted to a centimeter value.) Percentage values can't be converted since they are relative to the parent value (or another property value). There is one exception for color percentage values: since a color percentage value is relative to the range 0-255, a color percentage value can be converted to a number; (see also the RGBColor interface).

apiOperation.shortdesc: This method is used to get a float value in a specified unit.

apiException.apiDesc: INVALID_ACCESS_ERR: Raised if the CSS value doesn't contain a float value or if the float value can't be converted into the specified unit.

apiReturn.apiDesc: The float value in the specified unit.

apiParam.apiDesc: A unit code to get the float value. The unit code can only be a float unit type (i.e. CSS_NUMBER, CSS_PERCENTAGE, CSS_EMS, CSS_EXS, CSS_PX, CSS_CM, CSS_MM, CSS_IN, CSS_PT, CSS_PC, CSS_DEG, CSS_RAD, CSS_GRAD, CSS_MS, CSS_S, CSS_HZ, CSS_KHZ, CSS_DIMENSION).

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: This method is used to get a float value in a specified unit. If this CSS value doesn't contain a float value or can't be converted into the specified unit, a DOMException is raised.

apiOperation.shortdesc: This method is used to get the RGB color.

apiException.apiDesc: INVALID_ACCESS_ERR: Raised if the attached property can't return a RGB color value (e.g. this is not CSS_RGBCOLOR).

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: This method is used to get the RGB color. If this CSS value doesn't contain a RGB color value, a DOMException is raised. Modification to the corresponding style property can be achieved using the RGBColor interface.

apiOperation.shortdesc: This method is used to get the Rect value.

apiException.apiDesc: INVALID_ACCESS_ERR: Raised if the CSS value doesn't contain a Rect value. (e.g. this is not CSS_RECT).

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: This method is used to get the Rect value. If this CSS value doesn't contain a rect value, a DOMException is raised. Modification to the corresponding style property can be achieved using the Rect interface.

apiOperation.shortdesc: This method is used to get the string value.

apiException.apiDesc: INVALID_ACCESS_ERR: Raised if the CSS value doesn't contain a string value.

apiReturn.apiDesc: The string value in the current unit. The current primitiveType can only be a string unit type (i.e. CSS_STRING, CSS_URI, CSS_IDENT and CSS_ATTR).

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
This method is used to get the string value. If the CSS value doesn't contain a string value, a DOMException is raised.
Note: Some properties (like 'font-family' or 'voice-family') convert a whitespace separated list of idents to a string.

apiOperation.shortdesc: A method to set the float value with a specified unit.

apiException.apiDesc: INVALID_ACCESS_ERR: Raised if the attached property doesn't support the float value or the unit type.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this property is readonly.

apiParam.apiDesc: A unit code as defined above. The unit code can only be a float unit type (i.e. CSS_NUMBER, CSS_PERCENTAGE, CSS_EMS, CSS_EXS, CSS_PX, CSS_CM, CSS_MM, CSS_IN, CSS_PT, CSS_PC, CSS_DEG, CSS_RAD, CSS_GRAD, CSS_MS, CSS_S, CSS_HZ, CSS_KHZ, CSS_DIMENSION).
The new float value.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: A method to set the float value with a specified unit. If the property attached with this value can not accept the specified unit or the float value, the value will be unchanged and a DOMException will be raised.

apiOperation.shortdesc: A method to set the string value with the specified unit.

apiException.apiDesc: INVALID_ACCESS_ERR: Raised if the CSS value doesn't contain a string value or if the string value can't be converted into the specified unit.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this property is readonly.

apiParam.apiDesc: A string code as defined above. The string code can only be a string unit type (i.e. CSS_STRING, CSS_URI, CSS_IDENT, and CSS_ATTR).
The new string value.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: A method to set the string value with the specified unit. If the property attached to this value can't accept the specified unit or the string value, the value will be unchanged and a DOMException will be raised.

apiValue.shortdesc: The value is a attribute function.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The value is a attribute function. The value can be obtained by using the getStringValue method.

apiValue.shortdesc: The value is a length (cm).

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The value is a length (cm). The value can be obtained by using the getFloatValue method.

apiValue.shortdesc: The value is a counter or counters function.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The value is a counter or counters function. The value can be obtained by using the getCounterValue method.

apiValue.shortdesc: The value is an angle (deg).

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The value is an angle (deg). The value can be obtained by using the getFloatValue method.

apiValue.shortdesc: The value is a number with an unknown dimension.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The value is a number with an unknown dimension. The value can be obtained by using the getFloatValue method.

apiValue.shortdesc: The value is a length (ems).

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The value is a length (ems). The value can be obtained by using the getFloatValue method.

apiValue.shortdesc: The value is a length (exs).

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The value is a length (exs). The value can be obtained by using the getFloatValue method.

apiValue.shortdesc: The value is an angle (grad).

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The value is an angle (grad). The value can be obtained by using the getFloatValue method.

apiValue.shortdesc: The value is a frequency (Hz).

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The value is a frequency (Hz). The value can be obtained by using the getFloatValue method.

apiValue.shortdesc: The value is an identifier.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The value is an identifier. The value can be obtained by using the getStringValue method.

apiValue.shortdesc: The value is a length (in).

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The value is a length (in). The value can be obtained by using the getFloatValue method.

apiValue.shortdesc: The value is a frequency (kHz).

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The value is a frequency (kHz). The value can be obtained by using the getFloatValue method.

apiValue.shortdesc: The value is a length (mm).

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The value is a length (mm). The value can be obtained by using the getFloatValue method.

apiValue.shortdesc: The value is a time (ms).

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The value is a time (ms). The value can be obtained by using the getFloatValue method.

apiValue.shortdesc: The value is a simple number.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The value is a simple number. The value can be obtained by using the getFloatValue method.

link.linktext: W3C - CSS2: Integers and real numbers

apiValue.shortdesc: The value is a length (pc).

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The value is a length (pc). The value can be obtained by using the getFloatValue method.

apiValue.shortdesc: The value is a percentage.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The value is a percentage. The value can be obtained by using the getFloatValue method.

apiValue.shortdesc: The value is a length (pt).

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The value is a length (pt). The value can be obtained by using the getFloatValue method.

apiValue.shortdesc: The value is a length (px).

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The value is a length (px). The value can be obtained by using the getFloatValue method.

apiValue.shortdesc: The value is an angle (rad).

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The value is an angle (rad). The value can be obtained by using the getFloatValue method.

apiValue.shortdesc: The value is a rect function.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The value is a rect function. The value can be obtained by using the getRectValue method.

apiValue.shortdesc: The value is a RGB color.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The value is a RGB color. The value can be obtained by using the getRGBColorValue method.

apiValue.shortdesc: The value is a time (s).

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The value is a time (s). The value can be obtained by using the getFloatValue method.

apiValue.shortdesc: The value is a STRING.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The value is a STRING. The value can be obtained by using the getStringValue method.

apiValue.shortdesc: The value is not a recognized CSS2 value.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The value is not a recognized CSS2 value. The value can only be obtained by using the cssText attribute.

apiValue.shortdesc: The value is a URI.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The value is a URI. The value can be obtained by using the getStringValue method.

apiValue.shortdesc: The type of the value as defined by the constants specified above.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The type of the value as defined by the constants specified above.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: The CSSValue interface represents a simple or a complex value.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: The CSSValue interface represents a simple or a complex value. A CSSValue object only occurs in a context of a CSS property.

apiValue.shortdesc: The value is a custom value.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The value is a custom value.

apiValue.shortdesc: The value is inherited and the cssText contains "inherit".

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The value is inherited and the cssText contains "inherit".

apiValue.shortdesc: The value is a primitive value and an instance of the CSSPrimitiveValue interface can be obtained by using binding-specific casting methods on this instance of the CSSValue interface.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The value is a primitive value and an instance of the CSSPrimitiveValue interface can be obtained by using binding-specific casting methods on this instance of the CSSValue interface.

apiValue.shortdesc: The value is a CSSValue list and an instance of the CSSValueList interface can be obtained by using binding-specific casting methods on this instance of the CSSValue interface.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The value is a CSSValue list and an instance of the CSSValueList interface can be obtained by using binding-specific casting methods on this instance of the CSSValue interface.

apiValue.shortdesc: A string representation of the current value.

apiException.apiDesc: SYNTAX_ERR: Raised if the specified CSS string value has a syntax error and is unparsable.
INVALID_MODIFICATION_ERR: Raised if the specified CSS string value represents a different type of values than the values allowed by the CSS property.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this declaration is readonly or a property is readonly.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: A string representation of the current value.

apiValue.shortdesc: A code defining the type of the value as defined above.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: A code defining the type of the value as defined above.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This interface represents a CSS view.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
This interface represents a CSS view. The getComputedStyle method provides a read only access to the computed values of an element.
The expectation is that an instance of the ViewCSS interface can be obtained by using binding-specific casting methods on an instance of the AbstractView interface.
Since a computed style is related to an Element node, if this element is removed from the document, the associated CSSStyleDeclaration and CSSValue related to this declaration are no longer valid.

apiOperation.shortdesc: This method is used to get the computed style as it is defined in CSS2.

apiReturn.apiDesc: The computed style. The CSSStyleDeclaration is read-only and contains only absolute values.

apiParam.apiDesc: The element whose style is to be computed. This parameter cannot be null.
The pseudo-element or null if none.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: This method is used to get the computed style as it is defined in CSS2.

example.codeblock: var element = document.getElementById(elemId); var style = document.defaultView.getComputedStyle(element, pseudoElt);

apiClassifier.shortdesc: The CSSStyleDeclaration interface represents a single CSS declaration block.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
The CSSStyleDeclaration interface represents a single CSS declaration block.
TODO: Add MS proprietary methods

apiOperation.shortdesc: Used to retrieve the object representation of the value of a CSS property if it has been explicitly set within this declaration block.

apiReturn.apiDesc: Returns the value of the property if it has been explicitly set for this declaration block. Returns null if the property has not been set.

apiParam.apiDesc: The name of the CSS property.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Used to retrieve the object representation of the value of a CSS property if it has been explicitly set within this declaration block. This method returns null if the property is a shorthand property. Shorthand property values can only be accessed and modified as strings, using the getPropertyValue and setProperty methods.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Used to retrieve the priority of a CSS property (e.g.

apiReturn.apiDesc: A string representing the priority (e.g. "important") if one exists. The empty string if none exists.

apiParam.apiDesc: The name of the CSS property.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Used to retrieve the priority of a CSS property (e.g. the "important" qualifier) if the property has been explicitly set in this declaration block.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Used to retrieve the value of a CSS property if it has been explicitly set within this declaration block.

apiReturn.apiDesc: Returns the value of the property if it has been explicitly set for this declaration block. Returns the empty string if the property has not been set.

apiParam.apiDesc: The name of the CSS property.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Used to retrieve the value of a CSS property if it has been explicitly set within this declaration block.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Used to retrieve the properties that have been explicitly set in this declaration block.

apiReturn.apiDesc: The name of the property at this ordinal position. The empty string if no property exists at this position.

apiParam.apiDesc: Index of the property name to retrieve.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Used to retrieve the properties that have been explicitly set in this declaration block. The order of the properties retrieved using this method does not have to be the order in which they were set. This method can be used to iterate over all properties in this declaration block.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Used to remove a CSS property if it has been explicitly set within this declaration block.

apiException.apiDesc: NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this declaration is readonly or the property is readonly.

apiReturn.apiDesc: Returns the value of the property if it has been explicitly set for this declaration block. Returns the empty string if the property has not been set or the property name does not correspond to a known CSS property.

apiParam.apiDesc: The name of the CSS property.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Used to remove a CSS property if it has been explicitly set within this declaration block.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Used to set a property value and priority within this declaration block.

apiException.apiDesc: SYNTAX_ERR: Raised if the specified value has a syntax error and is unparsable.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this declaration is readonly or the property is readonly.

apiParam.apiDesc: The name of the CSS property.
The new value of the property.
The new priority of the property (e.g. "important").

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Used to set a property value and priority within this declaration block.

apiValue.shortdesc: The parsable textual representation of the declaration block (excluding the surrounding curly braces).

apiException.apiDesc: SYNTAX_ERR: Raised if the specified CSS string value has a syntax error and is unparsable.
NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised if this declaration is readonly or a property is readonly.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
The parsable textual representation of the declaration block (excluding the surrounding curly braces).
Setting this attribute will result in the parsing of the new value and resetting of all the properties in the declaration block including the removal or addition of properties.

apiValue.shortdesc: The number of properties that have been explicitly set in this declaration block.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The number of properties that have been explicitly set in this declaration block. The range of valid indices is 0 to length-1 inclusive.

apiValue.shortdesc: The CSS rule that contains this declaration block or null if this CSSStyleDeclaration is not attached to a CSSRule.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The CSS rule that contains this declaration block or null if this CSSStyleDeclaration is not attached to a CSSRule.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: The CSSValueList interface provides the abstraction of an ordered collection of CSS values.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
The CSSValueList interface provides the abstraction of an ordered collection of CSS values.
Some properties allow an empty list into their syntax. In that case, these properties take the none identifier. So, an empty list means that the property has the value none.
The items in the CSSValueList are accessible via an integral index, starting from 0.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Used to retrieve a CSSValue by ordinal index.

apiReturn.apiDesc: The CSSValue at the index position in the CSSValueList, or null if that is not a valid index.

apiParam.apiDesc: Index into the collection.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Used to retrieve a CSSValue by ordinal index. The order in this collection represents the order of the values in the CSS style property. If index is greater than or equal to the number of values in the list, this returns null.

apiValue.shortdesc: The number of CSSValues in the list.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The number of CSSValues in the list. The range of valid values of the indices is 0 to length-1 inclusive.
